result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary Lawrence Grose was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all of following by end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court waives all other court costs due to the defendant's inability to pay.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Carl S. and his family.  No contact with Tanza N. and her family.
No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.  No possession of drug paraphernalia.
AODA assessment.   Cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary.  Random urine screens.  Absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes: Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a Risk and Needs Assessment with DOC.  Comply with case goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and also that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary Lawrence Grose

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant.
Defendant's pro se request to vacate DNA surcharge.

Defendant Gary Lawrence Grose in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Gary Lawrence Grose in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court proceeded with the plea and sentencing hearing. Case passed.  Case recalled.  Court continued with the plea and sentencing hearing.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5 YEARS with 125 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and IS eligible the WI Substance Abuse program.
  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- no contact with Carl S and his family, no contact with Tanza N and her family
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- Random urine screens
- No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs; no possession of drug paraphernalia
- Absolute sobriety
- Provide a DNA sample.
Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Pay the DNA surcharges
Court waives all other court costs due to the defendant inability to pay
The Court ordered that DNA surcharges  be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Gary Lawrence Grose not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Gary Lawrence Grose not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests  more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.   Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Gary Lawrence Grose not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Return on bench warrant held. Bail hearing proceeded. Arguments by counsel.  Defense requests status date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant missed court on 05/06/2015.  Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 06/16/2015 at 8:30am, in Branch 22.  Parties notified.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Defendant has been discharged.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($1,000.00 signature bond) ad
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Bail/bond hearing on May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case calendared for bail review in Branch 22 on 05/06/2015 at 8:30am to address Justice Point violation, parties notified.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Parties contacted to schedule a bail review.

Defendant Gary Lawrence Grose in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference as well as to address a Justice Point violation. Court admonishes the defendant but does not amend bail.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 04/08/2015 received and filed. (12 Pages.)

Defendant Gary Lawrence Grose in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Eric Sweeney-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 4/7/15.

Defendant Gary Lawrence Grose in court with attorney Matt Lamke for Darryl E. Smith. Thomas Potter Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court to address Justice Point violation.  Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail.  Defendant is reminded of his previously scheduled Preliminary Hearing on 04/08/2015.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed. Defendant told to report to Branch 22 at 1:30 on 4/06/15 so that the Court can address the violation.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Gary Lawrence Grose in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Gary Lawrence Grose in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
